Method Detail

getTopWords

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTopWords(java.lang.String text,
                                                    int topCount)
Constructs a List of string representing most frequent words in a given text document

Parameters:
text - Input text from which the most frequent words needs to be determined
topCount - Number of most frequent words to be returned
Returns:
List of string containing the topCount number of words. Empty list if text is null or topCount is less than 0.

addToWordCountMap

public void addToWordCountMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> wordCount,
                              java.lang.String word)
Adds a string word to the given map. If the words is already present, increments the value count by 1

Parameters:
wordCount - the map to which the word needs to added or the count needs to be incremented
word - the word that needs to be added to the map

isEndOfWord

public boolean isEndOfWord(char c)
Utility method to tell if the given character is a end-of-word character. End of word characters is one of - , ; . ! blankspace

Parameters:
c - the character to be tested if it is a end-of-word character
Returns:
true if the character is end-of-word character. Else returns false
